Title: Gazprom's January-October export drop to Europe accounts for 85% of the firm's production cuts
Description: Russian producer Gazprom's 67.6 bn m3 cut in gas exports to countries beyond the Commonwealth of Independent States represents 85% of its production cuts in January-October. Meanwhile, Russian domestic demand for Gazprom supplies dropped by 11.1 bn m3, which accounts for 14% of the firm's production cuts
Author: DE

Title: Russia is confident Europeans will sign supply contracts via Turkey, but European traders doubt it
Description: Russia is confident that Europeans will sign contracts for supplies delivered at the new Turkish gas hub it is planning to create in cooperation with Turkey. But European traders doubt this will happen given Europe’s pivot away from Russian pipeline gas and switch to LNG, the time needed to increase Turkey’s export capacity to the EU, and the EU's reluctance to rely on Turkey
Author: DE

Title: October EU LNG imports rose by 11% month on month, 61% year on year
Description: EU LNG imports totalled 8.04 mt in October, a 11% increase from September and a 61% increase from October 2021. This is the fourth-biggest monthly volume imported this year as EU countries aimed to refill their underground storage as much as possible ahead of their Nov. 1 mandatory target and to prepare for their first winter without most of the usual Russian pipeline supplies.
Author: DE

Title: UPDATE: Freeport LNG may miss Nov restart target date without regulator’s restart approval
Description:
[Updates the story with comments in the third and fourth paragraphs from Freeport LNG that it continues to work towards a restart of the plant this month.]

The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG on Quintana Island, Texas, is in danger of missing its target of restarting in early-to-mid November, if it does not secure a written approval from the regulator within the next two weeks to restart operations.
Author: CK
